title: Kinetic energy - comparing three moving cars

content.question: Car Mass Speed <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> <math alttext="M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="4 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> <math alttext="2 M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="3 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> <math alttext="3 M sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>M</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="2 v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> The masses and speeds of three cars are given in the table. Cars <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> have kinetic energies <math alttext="K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="K sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub A is greater than K sub B, which is greater than K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub B is greater than K sub A, which is greater than K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub B equals K sub C, which is greater than K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub C is greater than K sub B, which is greater than K sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub B is greater than K sub A, which is greater than K sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
